009
010package imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving;
011
012import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterScalar;
013import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack.PixelSlice;
014
015/**
016 * <p>
017 * Scalar version of a Kuwahara-type filter, similar to the filter described in [1]. 
018 * It structures the filter region into five overlapping, 
019 * square subregions (including a center region) of size (r+1) x (r+1). 
020 * See Sec. 17.1 of [2] for additional details.
021 * </p>
022 * <p>
023 * [1] F. Tomita and S. Tsuji. Extraction of multiple regions by smoothing
024 * in selected neighborhoods. IEEE Transactions on Systems, Man,
025 * and Cybernetics 7, 394â€“407 (1977).
026 * <br>
027 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 
028 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
029 * </p>
030 * 
031 * @author WB
032 * @version 2021/01/02
033 */
034public class KuwaharaFilterScalar extends GenericFilterScalar implements KuwaharaF {
035        
036        private final int n;                    // fixed subregion size 
037        private final int dm;                   // = d-
038        private final int dp;                   // = d+
039        private final float tsigma;
040
041        // constructor using default settings
042        public KuwaharaFilterScalar() {
043                this(new Parameters());
044        }
045        
046        public KuwaharaFilterScalar(Parameters params) {
047                int r = params.radius;
048                this.n = (r + 1) * (r + 1);             // size of complete filter
049                this.dm = (r / 2) - r;                  // d- = top/left center coordinate
050                this.dp = this.dm + r;                  // d+ = bottom/right center coordinate
051                this.tsigma = (float)params.tsigma;
052        }
053        
054        // ------------------------------------------------------
055
056        private float Smin;             // min. variance
057        private float Amin;                     
058        
059        @Override
060        protected float doPixel(PixelSlice plane, int u, int v) {
061                Smin = Float.MAX_VALUE;
062                evalSubregionGray(plane, u, v);         // a centered subregion (not in original Kuwahara)
063                Smin = Smin - tsigma * n;                               // tS * n because we use variance scaled by n
064                evalSubregionGray(plane, u + dm, v + dm);
065                evalSubregionGray(plane, u + dm, v + dp);
066                evalSubregionGray(plane, u + dp, v + dm);
067                evalSubregionGray(plane, u + dp, v + dp);
068                
069                return Amin;
070        } 
071        
072        // sets the member variables Smin, Amin
073        private void evalSubregionGray(PixelSlice source, int u, int v) {
074                float S1 = 0; 
075                float S2 = 0;
076                for (int j = dm; j <= dp; j++) {
077                        for (int i = dm; i <= dp; i++) {
078                                float a = source.getVal(u+i, v+j);
079                                S1 = S1 + a;
080                                S2 = S2 + a * a;
081                        }
082                }
083//              double s = (sum2 - sum1*sum1/n)/n;      // actual sigma^2
084                float s = S2 - S1 * S1 / n;                     // s = n * sigma^2
085                if (s < Smin) {
086                        Smin = s;
087                        Amin = S1 / n; // mean
088                }
089        }
090}
